channel.title: How to make my server run?
channel.description:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,480500.0.html I'm using this as my source and client.
I compiled.
When i click run.bat this happens
" 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
When i edit run.bat it says
@echo off title Project Insanity [u][b]java[/b][/u] -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause
How do i find the java path? to put into run? :l

item.title: How to make my server run?
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Yeah well you would never have to do that again if you just set your environment variables…

Read full topic
item.source: How to make my server run?

item.title: How to make my server run?
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

staticfish1:

My way does work…

Thats right

staticfish1:

Change java to “C:\program files\java\jdk1.6.0_YOURVERSION”

what he means is go to Start and click run
then type ’ C:\program files\java ’
(if you have C:\program files (x86) Use it)
then find the folder that has the highest number on it, with jdk infront of it EG: jdk1.6.0_15… That is your version
So your Run.bat should look like
@echo off
title Project Insanity
C:\program files\java>>YOURVERSION<<\bin\java.exe -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

Read full topic
item.source: How to make my server run?
